translated: z wyjątkiem, o ile nie zdarzy się
explanation: except if a particular thing happens
sentence: We should arrive at ten o'clock, barring any unexpected delays.
sentence_gap: We should arrive at ten o'clock, _______ any unexpected delays.

explanation: (disapproving) a small group of people who spend their time together and do not welcome other people into that group
sentence: There's a clique at work that never talks to anyone else.
sentence_gap: There's a ______ at work that never talks to anyone else.

explanation: to make someone who is sad or disappointed feel better by giving them comfort or sympathy
sentence: He tried to console her, but she kept saying it was all her own fault.
sentence_gap: He tried to _______ her, but she kept saying it was all her own fault.

explanation: the freedom or power to decide what should be done in a particular situation
sentence: Troopers have discretion in deciding whom to stop for speeding.
sentence_gap: Troopers have __________ in deciding whom to stop for speeding.

explanation: a pair of small pieces of material like fur worn over the ears with a strap that goes over the head to keep them on
sentence: Personal protective equipment such as hard hats and earmuffs also came into use.
sentence_gap: Personal protective equipment such as hard hats and ________ also came into use.

explanation: to cook something such as a fish, or an egg with its shell removed, by putting it in gently boiling water or other liquid
sentence: We had poached eggs for breakfast.

explanation: an operation to change the shape of the nose
sentence: Rhinoplasty is a form of plastic surgery.
sentence_gap: ___________ is a form of plastic surgery.

sentence: The air was filled with the scent of wild flowers.
sentence_gap: The air was filled with the _____ of wild flowers.

explanation: informal; looking dirty or in bad condition and likely to be involved in dishonest or illegal activities
sentence: He didn't like the look of the seedy characters who were hanging around outside the bar.
sentence_gap: He didn't like the look of the _____ characters who were hanging around outside the bar.

explanation: to walk slowly and awkwardly, without lifting your feet correctly
sentence: Sick patients shambled along the hospital corridors.
sentence_gap: Sick patients ________ along the hospital corridors.

explanation: grand and impressive beauty; the beautiful and impressive features or qualities of something, especially a place
sentence: They bought a decaying 16th-century manor house and restored it to its original splendor.
sentence_gap: They bought a decaying 16th-century manor house and restored it to its original ________.

explanation: a particular characteristic that can produce a particular type of behavior
sentence: Arrogance is a very unattractive personality trait.
sentence_gap: Arrogance is a very unattractive personality _____.

explanation: (disapproving) someone who is weak, either physically or in character
sentence: It would need more than a few exercises to turn a seven-stone weakling into a heavyweight boxer.
sentence_gap: It would need more than a few exercises to turn a seven-stone ________ into a heavyweight boxer.

explanation: to make a high, rough noise while breathing because of some breathing difficulty
sentence: I know when I've been smoking too much because I start to wheeze when I run for a train.
sentence_gap: I know when I've been smoking too much because I start to ______ when I run for a train.

explanation: literary; made or done in a careful or decorative way
sentence: The new album contains some carefully wrought new songs and a number of familiar hits.
sentence_gap: The new album contains some carefully _______ new songs and a number of familiar hits.
